intro: Flaveria mcdougallii, commonly known as the Texas ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and narrow, hairy leaves. Its small yellow flowers bloom in late summer, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators. Flaveria mcdougallii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats.
